text:
same here!
Not sure about you, but on my case the globals are copied from another portal and noticed that if it includes for example a menu module or something like that, then I will get some error `""` but as soon as I fix any of that default content imported from the other portal. Some of the issues are gone (but I still have some that I don't know where they come from)
:eyes:
<@U26D0TF8E>, <@U7ADCU3BM>, <@U25C65C3S> - A fix for the above issue is on the way.
Thank you!
Perhaps they can make it so we can use brackets again in our theme file names () or [] would be nice.
we use them to filter templates in search
The fix has been deployed. If any of you have a second to confirm on your end that would be great.
is this fix for the cloned global module or any global module? We tried creating a brand new global module to replace the one that wouldn't work so trying to see which one to test
It should fix both
<@U22PNRAJD> updating the cloned global module works now!

Something wrong with date formatting? 
I’m getting strange output
- time zone is set to +02:00 (account settings)
- blog is set to belgian dutch +02:00 
- a date selector is used in a module, and as example 17 june 2018 10:00 is added
- but this date is displayed 17 june 2018 08:00
- if you check output date with %Z you have >> +0000
>> seems like a date in a module does not have timezone?
<@U26B530N6> do you mind take a look on this? we found a weird issue with |datetimeformat :slightly_smiling_face:
Looking
I think they do this to improve file compatibility with different operating systems because of their FTP and HubL local server thing. not 100% sure though

I’m migrating a portal to DM2.0 and getting a bug where I will convert a module and list it as page module (sometimes doesn’t actually list this in its initial open and just calls it a module), then when I reopen it, it is automatically converted to a page, blog, and email module and takes away the CSS and JS areas.
choose page
type not shown
type converted automatically on reopen
<@U22PNRAJD> ^

seeing a ton of 400 responses on <https://api.HubSpot.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets/${MODULEID}/buffer?portalId=${PORTALID}&clienttimeout=7000> and <https://api.HubSpot.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets/${MODULEID}/buffer/upgrade?portalId=${PORTALID}&clienttimeout=7000> now that I open the console
manually changing these once a module is updated seems to be stable, but I haven’t had a single initial migration’s type stick
It looks like the team is aware of this issue and is working on a fix. Thanks for reporting
Thanks for reporting. We are looking into the issue
Glad to hear you have a short term workaround
were there some changes pushed to the design manager today? It has been the most frustrating day to try to make any edits on any portal

So i copied a module from one portal (in DMv2) to another portal (also using DMv2) and none of the contents of the module copied over. The module itself copied over, but there is nothing in the module when you open it. Has anyone ran into this before?
i've copied/pasted the content for now, but just wanted to give a heads up on this just in case
